meanings.sent1: She misrenders the colors in her drawings sometimes.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misrender the information in your report.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a misrender if the map showed the park on the wrong side of town.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to misrender the facts was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The artist's misrendering of the landscape made it look like a scene from a dream.

meanings.sent1: They misrendered the foreign phrase and ended up saying something entirely different.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misrender the meaning of the ancient text.
meanings.sent3: The misrendered instructions led to a hilarious cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her misrendering of his words turned a compliment into an insult.
meanings.sent5: The misrendered message caused confusion among the team members.

meanings.sent1: The artist misrenders the historical events in his paintings.
meanings.sent2: The movie misrenders the true story it is based on.
meanings.sent3: The misrendered statue had an unintentionally comical expression.
meanings.sent4: Her misrendering of the character made him seem like a completely different person.
meanings.sent5: The misrendered details in the mural made it look like a jumbled mess.
